summary: The 'Tax Relief for New Businesses Act' aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to provide tax relief for new businesses. Key provisions include consolidating deductions for start-up and organizational expenditures, increasing the limitations for deductible new business expenses (adjusting the amounts from $5,000 to $50,000 and $50,000 to $150,000), and modifying net operating loss rules concerning these expenditures. The amendments apply to expenses in taxable years starting after December 31, 2025.
